perturbation.original_text: 4.2 The Service Fee of the last quarter shall be paid prior to the seventh business day following the commencement of the next quarter. Such Service Fee shall be paid to the bank account designated by Party B in writing. If Party B intends to change its bank account, it shall send a written notice to Party A seven business days in advance.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 The Service Fee of the last quarter shall be paid prior to the seventh business day following the commencement of the next quarter. Such Service Fee shall be paid to the bank account designated by Party B in writing. If Party B intends to change its bank account, it shall send a written notice to Party A thirty business days in advance.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by changing the notice period for bank account changes from seven to thirty business days. This creates ambiguity about the correct notification period, potentially leading to payment disputes and uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.changed_text:
6.1 Prior to the expiration of the Term of Cooperation , this Agreement shall only be terminated upon occurrence of the followingcircumstances:

  6.1.1 Party B shall have the right to terminate this Agreement in advance without the prior written consent from Party A, by sending a written notice to Party A but Party A may not terminate or rescind this Agreement; such notice must be given at least 90 days in advance.

  6.1.2 One Party requests to terminate this Agreement when the other Party is declared bankrupt in accordance with the laws;

  6.1.3 Party B fails to provide Party B's Services to Party A for more than three consecutive years due to the force majeure event.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'such notice must be given at least 90 days in advance' to section 6.1.1 creates a contradiction. The original clause gives Party B the right to terminate in advance without stating any specific notice period but the added clause contradicts this by requiring a 90-day notice. This uncertainty regarding the required notice period could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 If any Party commits any act in violation of this Agreement, such Party shall assume the liabilities for breach according to this Agreement and applicable laws. If both Parties breach this Agreement, they shall each assume their own liabilities for breach respectively. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions, neither Party shall be responsible to the other Party in respect of any indirect loss or damage caused hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 If any Party commits any act in violation of this Agreement, such Party shall assume the liabilities for breach according to this Agreement and applicable laws. If both Parties breach this Agreement, they shall each assume their own liabilities for breach respectively. Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions, the breaching party shall be responsible to the other Party in respect of any indirect loss or damage caused hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'neither Party' to 'the breaching party' in the last sentence of section 8.1, a contradiction is introduced regarding liability for indirect losses or damages. The original text explicitly excludes responsibility for indirect losses, while the modified text includes it. This conflict creates ambiguity over which rule applies in the event of a breach, leading to legal uncertainty.
